subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=3|rs=干05}}

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kan|こう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The ''good fortune'' and ''happiness'' senses are generally considered as overlapping.

subSections.title: Synonyms
Etymology 2
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|しあわせ|yomi=k|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|幸せ}}, {{ja-l|仕合せ}}, {{ja-l|仕合わせ}}, {{ja-l|倖せ}}

subSections.title: Adjective
Conjugation
subSections.text: {{ja-na|しあわせ}}

subSections.title: Noun
Synonyms
Etymology 3
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|さいわい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|幸い}}

subSections.title: Adjective
Conjugation
subSections.text: {{ja-na|さいわい}}

subSections.title: Adverb
Usage notes
subSections.text: When used as an adverb without a particle, this term usually comes at the start of the sentence. It also appears used with advervial particles {{ja-r|に}} and {{ja-r|と}}, or, perhaps more commonly, in an adverbial construction as {{lang|ja|幸なことに}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|さいわい|hhira=さいはひ}}

# very good [[fortune]] and [[happiness]], especially as [[bestow]]ed by [[god]]s, [[spirit]]s, [[buddha]]s, or other entities
# an occurrence of good [[luck]] or good [[fortune]]
# {{qualifier|derivation unknown}} the [[tail]] and back [[fin]]s of a [[carp]] or other fish, as used in [[cooking]]

subSections.title: Synonyms
Etymology 4
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|さきわい}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|幸い}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Obsolete in modern Japanese, replaced by ''saiwai'' above.

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}; {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}; {{ja-r|幸|さち}}

subSections.title: Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さき}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=さき}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Possibly cognate with {{m|ja|先|tr=saki||tip, point; future, ahead}} from the idea of ''[favorable] future''. Possibly also related to ''sachi'' / ''satsu'' below.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|さき}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text:
The ''good fortune'' and ''happiness'' senses are generally considered as overlapping.

''Saki'' in this sense appears to be obsolete in modern Japanese.

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}; {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}; {{ja-r|幸|さち}}

subSections.title: Etymology 6
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|さちわい}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|幸い}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Obsolete in modern Japanese, replaced by ''saiwai'' above. In historical Japanese, ''sachiwai'' appears to be a rarer variant of ''sakiwai'' above.

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}; {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}; {{ja-r|幸|さち}}

subSections.title: Etymology 7
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|さち|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Adjective
subSections.text:
{{ja-adj|infl=na|さち}}

# very [[fortunate]] and [[happy]]

subSections.title: Inflection
subSections.text: {{ja-na|さち}}

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 8
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さつ}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=さつ|-}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>, from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*satu}}. Possibly cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-inline|살||arrow}}. Possibly also related with ''saki'' above.

The kanji may have originally been applied to this word for the source Chinese term's associations with good fortune.

This is the [[bound]] form of ''sachi'' above. This form is only ever used in compounds. Possibly the original form.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|さつ}}

subSections.title: Prefix
